html.display_name: Definitions of Linearly Independent and Dependent
html.p: We say that a list of vectors [mathjaxinline]\{ v_1; v_2; \ldots v_ n\}[/mathjaxinline] in a vector space [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] is linearly independent if the only way to pick scalars [mathjaxinline]a_1, a_2, \ldots a_ n[/mathjaxinline] such that [mathjaxinline]a_1v_1 + a_2v_2 + \ldots + a_ nv_ n = \mathbf{0}[/mathjaxinline] is if [mathjaxinline]a_1 = a_2 = \ldots = a_ n = 0[/mathjaxinline].

A list of vectors [mathjaxinline]\{ v_1; v_2; \ldots v_ n\}[/mathjaxinline] in a vector space [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] is linearly dependent if there are scalars [mathjaxinline]a_1, a_2, \ldots a_ n[/mathjaxinline], not all zero, such that [mathjaxinline]a_1v_1 + a_2v_2 + \ldots + a_ nv_ n = \mathbf{0}[/mathjaxinline].
